summary:
Jannik Sinner won the 2024 US Open tennis tournament by beating Taylor Fritz in the final. This is his second big win, making him the first Italian man to win the US Open and the youngest to win both the Australian Open and US Open in the same year.

Novak Djokovic, the previous champion, lost early, meaning he didn't win any major titles this year. This is also the first time since 2002 that none of the top three players won a major tournament.

The tournament had an all-American semifinal and the longest match in US Open history between Dan Evans and Karen Khachanov.
